}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:05.000

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:31.000
    | text      = And almost get into a fractured mindset
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:45.000
    | text      = And that's a good thing at certain levels

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:47.000

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:49.000

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:50.000
    | text      = But then when you don't get to even 10% of what you want to cover
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:53.000
    | text      = It's a real frustration
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:55.000

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:57.000

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:00.000

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:03.000
    | text      = Yeah
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:04.000
    | text      = What he's describing is like he sits around and reads headlines
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:07.000
    | text      = And makes tenuous connections between things
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:10.000
    | text      = And then when he gets on air he knows like, oh this is going to sound stupid

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = Yeah
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = At best that's what he's saying

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:33.000

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = Yeah
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:40.000
    | text      = So here we go, we get to what his headline, leading story is
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:44.000
    | text      = And it's actually really interesting
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:46.000
    | text      = Because there's a really good story he could tell here
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:50.000
    | text      = But he tells the wrong story
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:52.000
    | text      = Okay it's great to be officially back
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:54.000
    | text      = I mean I was back yesterday for the Sunday show
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:56.000
    | text      = But here we are on the big weekday show
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:58.000
    | text      = Let me just try to go over the stacks
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:01.000
    | text      = How's that sound?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:03.000
    | text      = Let me just start, because I'm trying to figure out what the top story is to me
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:07.000
    | text      = I don't just go with whatever the national news top story is
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:11.000
    | text      = Take that national news
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:12.000
    | text      = I go with what I believe the top story is
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:14.000
    | text      = Of course you can tell what you think is most important
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:16.000
    | text      = A lot of times callers call in or we get emails or see comments
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:20.000
    | text      = Saying, hey why didn't you cover this?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:21.000
    | text      = And that becomes our top story because I agree with you, I think it's important
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:25.000
    | text      = The DOT is on the road
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:26.000
    | text      = Homeless
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:27.000
    | text      = Houston veterans cited for dumpster diving in search for food
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:32.000
    | text      = That's news 92 FM, they have a copy of the ticket
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:36.000
    | text      = And they've banned feeding the homeless in Houston
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:39.000
    | text      = So they just say, what do they do, die?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:41.000
    | text      = And what a sign of an amazing tyranny
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:46.000
    | text      = Such an amazing tyranny
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:48.000
    | text      = You can really tell that Alex is kind of rusty here
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:51.000
    | text      = Because he's back from vacation
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:53.000
    | text      = And his mind is still in Barton Springs or wherever he went
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:57.000
    | text      = He's spinning his wheels knowing that he has a big pile of paper in front of him
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:00.000
    | text      = But he doesn't have any narratives that have any momentum carrying over from the previous day
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:05.000
    | text      = Generally speaking, when his show has
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:07.000
    | text      = You have these narratives that you built yesterday that you build upon or you pivot from
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:12.000
    | text      = That's sort of the routine in his show
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:15.000
    | text      = But when you come from a clean break
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:17.000
    | text      = That week plus break has hit the skids for any narratives that he was spinning before
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:23.000
    | text      = His big gigantic investigative report that he was teasing hasn't materialized
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:27.000
    | text      = And he's just completely forgotten about it
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:29.000
    | text      = Not a surprise
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:30.000
    | text      = The PR blitz from fighting Piers Morgan and having Michael Savage on the show
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:33.000
    | text      = Has died down because of that week plus he was gone
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:36.000
    | text      = He's got to get going from a complete standstill
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:39.000
    | text      = And this is how that looks
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:41.000
    | text      = I'll say that he makes a fair point
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:43.000
    | text      = That he doesn't just take his news as talking points from the mainstream media
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:47.000
    | text      = That is fair
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:48.000
    | text      = Though it's laughable for him to say that he just covers what he thinks is important
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:51.000
    | text      = Multiple times we've heard him literally say on the show that he's just reading headlines from Drudge
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:56.000
    | text      = He gets his talking points from Drudge
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:58.000
    | text      = Pretty much
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:59.000
    | text      = In an instance that is all too rare
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:01.000
    | text      = I find myself superficially agreeing almost completely with Alex
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:05.000
    | text      = It's ridiculous that this homeless man in Houston got a ticket for scavenging for food in a trash can
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:11.000
    | text      = That is terrible
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:12.000
    | text      = However when we start to examine what we think is bad about the situation
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:16.000
    | text      = That's when we disagree with Alex
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:18.000
    | text      = Exactly
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:19.000
    | text      = Right right right
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:20.000
    | text      = His take on it is that this is government tyranny on display
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:23.000
    | text      = My take on it is that when humans are eating out of trash cans
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:26.000
    | text      = We have a problem whether they get a ticket for it or not
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:29.000
    | text      = Yeah
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:30.000
    | text      = Alex doesn't have any solutions outside of just saying that churches and charities
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:33.000
    | text      = Should voluntarily solve the problem
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:35.000
    | text      = As if those groups aren't already making large contributions to housing and feeding those experiencing homelessness
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:41.000
    | text      = He refuses to accept that there's a better solution
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:44.000
    | text      = Because the actual solution is completely against his political beliefs
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:48.000
    | text      = And Houston is actually a perfect example of that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:51.000
    | text      = In 2011 Houston reached its peak in terms of the homeless population at 8,538
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:58.000
    | text      = And punitive rules about sleeping in public and scavenging for food were not having the desired effect
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:04.000
    | text      = What?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:05.000
    | text      = Ultimately those rules just criminalize being homeless
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:08.000
    | text      = So you end up incarcerating homeless people which costs the taxpayers more
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:11.000
    | text      = No it's cheaper
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:12.000
    | text      = Or giving them tickets they can't pay which can ultimately lead to their incarceration
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:16.000
    | text      = Or driving them off to some other city where they can become someone else's problem
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:20.000
    | text      = None of the possible outcomes of that strategy offers an actual solution
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:25.000
    | text      = And Houston learned that lesson
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:27.000
    | text      = In 2010 the Department of Housing and Urban Development had chosen Houston as a priority city
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:31.000
    | text      = Based on its high rate of people living without homes
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:34.000
    | text      = They took the time to analyze the issues, set up some infrastructure
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:37.000
    | text      = Then in 2011 they began implementing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:40.000
    | text      = And their plans have paid off massively
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:42.000
    | text      = In 2019 the rate of homelessness has dropped in Houston by 54%
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:47.000
    | text      = And a lot of that is directly attributable to federal assistance
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:50.000
    | text      = And most importantly a coordinated approach
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:53.000
    | text      = Since 2012 Houston has housed approximately 17,000 people
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:57.000
    | text      = Mike Nichols, interim CEO of the Coalition of the Homeless in Houston and Harris County
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:02.000
    | text      = Told the Texas Tribune
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:04.000
    | text      = If you have a homeless person and you put them in a permanent supportive housing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:08.000
    | text      = And simultaneously give them social, behavioral and health support services
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:11.000
    | text      = 92% of them will be stable in that facility
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:15.000
    | text      = Houston represents a model people interested in homelessness and housing issues
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:19.000
    | text      = Could learn a lot from and many of them have
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:21.000
    | text      = But learning anything from it requires you to let go of your insistence
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:24.000
    | text      = That the federal government shouldn't do anything
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:27.000
    | text      = If you're supposedly anti-homelessness and anti-government doing anything
}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:28:15.000
    | text      = And from everything I can tell, he's basically just made a career out of taking on cases that seek to cripple government regulation of non-medical medicine
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:28:22.000
    | text      = His claim to fame is that he's beaten the FDA in court more than anybody else, and I guess I believe that's probably true

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:28:28.000
    | text      = In 2010, he won a suit against the FDA that allowed supplement companies to make, quote, qualified health claims about their products

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:28:35.000

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:29:09.000
    | text      = His litigation has genuinely allowed them all sorts of wiggle room that they need in order to defraud tons of people totally legally
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:29:16.000

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:29:22.000
    | text      = And the main cases use Dirk Peterson and Sandy Shaw as their defendants
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:29:28.000
    | text      = Pearson and Shaw are supplement designers who make their money by licensing their products to companies who sell them
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:29:34.000
    | text      = So it goes like this
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:29:35.000
    | text      = The Federal Trade Commission wants to enforce a rule like you can't make health claims about your product

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:29:50.000

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:29:54.000

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:30:00.000
    | text      = Or relief of temporary irregularity for fear that the FTC will deem the claims deceptive advertising

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:30:11.000

{{TranscriptBlock
